He says in verse number 18, notice what he says, for the scripture saith. This is a biblical truth. This is not just Timothy, Paul's opinion that he's given to Timothy. He says, this is a, the scripture saith. This is a biblical truth. By the way, when he uses this phrase and says, for the scripture saith, he references really two verses of scripture. Thou shall not muzzle the ox that treadeth out the corn, and the laborer is worthy of his reward. We're not going to take the time, but if you went back to Deuteronomy 25 in verse number four, and if you went back to Luke chapter 10 in verse number seven, those are the two references that are given to us in verse number 18. And we find that Paul, under the inspiration of the Holy Spirit of God, refers to both of those as being scripture. And that's an important thing for us to understand. I'm so thankful for the scripture, for the word of God, for thus saith the Lord. And so what does he say?
